Bring the speed of CenturyLink internet to your home

CenturyLink brings a connection that delivers—whether that looks like high-speed internet or fiber internet. With rates that won’t break the piggy bank, CenturyLink equips your home with multiple-device connection support, in-home WiFi, and the ability to easily stream content.

CenturyLink makes it easy to stay in touch. Home Phone plans include unlimited nationwide calling and are available as a standalone service or pair in a bundle. Choose a new CenturyLink phone number or keep your old landline number.

Strengthen your connection to family and friends with the dependability of a landline, reliable calls, and a device that’s harder to misplace.

Offer details

All speeds up to 100 Mbps

Order at 1-833-550-5332

Why choose CenturyLink Fiber for busy households?

Two words: speed and latency. With Mbps counts in the triple digits and ultra-low lag, CenturyLink Fiber Internet creates a responsive experience for practically everything you do. That includes upload-heavy activities like video calls, online gaming, and file sharing—in households stacked with devices, where everyone’s online all the time.

Up to 20x faster upload speeds than cable^

Upload a 2 GB school project in 18 seconds instead of 8 minutes.

^Comparison, as of 10/7/22, based on CenturyLink fiber technology with wired upload speeds of up to 940 Mbps to major cable providers 1GIG cable service over DOCSIS 3.1 technology with upload speeds of 35 Mbps

Virtually lag-free media

Leave spinning buffer wheels in the past while Fortnite, Disney+, and Zoom run simultaneously on multiple devices. Low latency and symmetrical speeds up to 940 Mbps leave plenty of room on the network for everyone’s required and restful activities.

Always-on cloud life

Auto-backup thousands of vacation photos, maintain steady access to your cloud apps during the workday, and get the kids video chatting with Mom at the same time, all with exceptional performance. With fiber’s headroom, cloud apps and actions sync fast and often.

Future-proof network

Prepare for rapidly growing bandwidth needs as AI, virtual reality, and 4K video become more standard—and for the technologies no one sees coming. Fiber-optic networks can be rapidly upgraded to deliver multiple gigs of speed and beyond.

Fiber-powered phone bundles & TV add-ons
Save time chasing down multiple services. Get high-performing utilities and boundless entertainment with one call to CenturyLink Internet today.
Call 1-833-550-5332
Internet + home phone

Add CenturyLink home phone to your fiber internet order for pristine voice quality and more:

Unlimited nationwide calling
Free E911
Battery backup
Combined bill with internet

Add DISH or DIRECTV to watch live TV and stream what you missed On Demand. With fiber speeds, your favorite sports, movies, and TV shows will stream at top quality.

Unlimited cloud DVR
2-year TV price guarantees

No annual contracts

Pair CenturyLink with TV for the full experience

With high-speed internet and nonstop televised entertainment, your setup will create a hub that draws family members and friends year round for sporting events, awards shows, or random cozy movie nights. Learn more about recommended TV providers below or call 1-833-550-5332 to start your order.

DIRECTV, starting at 90+ channels (now without a satellite dish!)
DISH, starting at 190+ channels
More about partner TV
Unlock faster speeds with CenturyLink Fiber Internet

Get the fastest speeds available with the CenturyLink Fiber plan up to 940 Mbps. Once you’re on the fiber-optic network, you can game more, stream more, download more, and do more of what you love online with less hassle and wasted time. Speeds up to 940 Mbps are still coming to new areas all the time, so check availability now to see if they’ve reached yours.

Maximum download/upload speed of up to 940 Mbps via a wired connection. Speed may not be available in your area.

Check availability
Built-in CenturyLink WiFi for seamless connectivity

Experience the ultimate in-home connectivity. With your modem connected to CenturyLink’s 99.9% reliable* CenturyLink network, you can expect a smooth online experience for everything from streaming and gaming to video calls and smart home automations. For the best experience, lease the CenturyLink modem and count on total network compatibility and customer support.

*Based on network uptime or availability

Set yourself up for WiFi success >

High-speed CenturyLink Internet
Frequently asked questions
Expand AllCollapse All

What is a good download speed?

According to the FCC, download speeds of 100 Mbps qualify as high-speed broadband, with speeds above and below that considered basic and advanced, respectively.

Speeds up to 100 Mbps support essential internet needs, like browsing, checking email, and light streaming. Speeds above 100 Mbps are best for competitive gamers, constant streamers, and anyone else “chronically online”—especially if you share the house with others or multitask with several devices.

Limited availability. Service in select locations only.

FCC.gov, “FCC Increases Broadband Speed Benchmark,” March 2024.

Shop CenturyLink Internet speeds >

Can I compare my current speeds with CenturyLink speeds?

Yes. Use the CenturyLink speed test to see how your connection compares to CenturyLink high-speed internet plans.

Do CenturyLink Internet plans have unlimited data?

Yes, every CenturyLink high-speed internet plan offers unlimited data so you can surf and stream whenever and for as long as you want.

Can I self-install CenturyLink Internet?

Sometimes, depending on your CenturyLink Internet plan and location. Simply Unlimited is almost always available for self-install. Select fiber addresses may be eligible for self-install too, but most require professional installation since there’s no preexisting wiring to the larger CenturyLink network.

Limited availability. Service in select locations only.

Is CenturyLink Internet good for users who work from home?

Absolutely. Working from home is a breeze with high-speed internet, especially on CenturyLink Fiber’s 99.9% reliable* network. Its low latency and symmetrical upload speeds help your calls and file shares go through smoothly, while high overall speeds and unlimited data leave room for other internet users in your home, even at your busiest times.

*Based on network uptime or availability

What is the highest internet speed for CenturyLink?

CenturyLink Fiber Internet offers speeds up to 940 Mbps in select areas. These speeds are ideal for households with multiple users and devices, supporting activities like streaming in 4K, online gaming, and large file downloads, all with low lag.

Limited availability. Service in select locations only.

Is CenturyLink 100 Mbps good?

At maximum wired speeds of 100 Mbps, CenturyLink Simply Unlimited meets the definition of high-speed broadband. In homes where Simply Unlimited speeds don’t quite reach 100 Mbps, though, this plan still provides essential bandwidth for common activities like browsing, checking email, making digital voice calls, and light streaming. 

Simply Unlimited is ideal for households of 1–2 people who regularly use multiple devices or households of 2–3 people who have lighter internet habits.

Limited availability. Service in select locations only.

FCC.gov, “FCC Increases Broadband Speed Benchmark,” March 2024.

Is CenturyLink fast enough for gaming?

CenturyLink Fiber Internet plans are perfect for gaming. The low ping rate (lag) makes your clicks more responsive; the ultrafast, symmetrical speeds make multiplayer interactions smoother; and the 99.9% reliable* network keeps signal drops out of your way.

Limited availability. Service in select locations only.

Unlike fiber plans, Simply Unlimited Internet isn’t ideal for gaming. That said, you might be able to enjoy single-player or mobile games when your network isn’t busy. Call 1-833-550-5332 today to check plan availability near you.

How does CenturyLink Fiber connect to the house?

Like all wired internet services, CenturyLink Fiber connects to the house via extended cables that stretch from the larger local network directly to your home. During installation, your CenturyLink technician will lay the fiber optics right up to your home’s exterior, set up a small device called an Optical Network Terminal (ONT), then drill a new hookup where you’ll plug in your WiFi gateway.

Is CenturyLink changing to fiber optic?

In many areas, yes, CenturyLink has replaced its legacy copper network with fiber-optic infrastructure for improved speeds, low lag, and overall reliability. The plan is to continue this effort throughout the country—check availability now to see if fiber has arrived in your area.

Is fiber optic better than WiFi?

Yes and no. Fiber optics send data faster than any other internet technology, including the wireless technology we now call WiFi. However, fiber and WiFi aren’t usually competing services. Usually, WiFi just refers to the personal wireless network your modem creates by converting signals from your provider’s core network.

When that core network is a fiber-optic one, you can expect the benefits of fiber to carry into your WiFi—including high speeds, low latency, and reliable signal fit for large households and heavy internet use.

What is the difference: DISH vs DIRECTV?

DISH TV and DIRECTV are both satellite TV providers that provide hundreds of channel options. The most significant difference is the availability of each service. To check availability, enter your ZIP code and find the right package for you.

What if I want a standalone TV service?

No problem! CenturyLink Internet brings you a dependable high-speed connection, but if you prefer a TV-only plan, you can shop for TV products without bundling. Check your ZIP code to find what TV services are available in your area.

These cookies allow us to count visits and traffic sources so we can measure and improve the performance of our site. If you do not allow these cookies we will not know when you have visited our site, and will not be able to monitor its performance.

title: Terms and Conditions | CenturyLinkQuote.com
content:
CenturyLink terms & conditions

Call Now 1-877-916-1977Order Online

Call Now 1-877-916-1977Order Online

Simply Unlimited Internet

*The CTL Fee is the Facility Relocation Cost Recovery Fee. This is neither a tax nor required by law but set by CenturyLink and may change. For information about taxes and fees, visit centurylink.com/ feesandtaxes.




Customer speed experiences will vary, particularly when accessing the Internet wirelessly from various devices.  Download speeds are via a wired connection.  Internet speeds are not guaranteed due to conditions outside of network control, including customer location, devices, equipment, and access through a wired or wireless connection; see centurylink.com/internetpolicy for more information.




Service is not available everywhere. Offer is available to qualifying customers only. Limited time offer.  Monthly service rate, leased equipment rates, installation and constructions fees, taxes, and fees are subject to change and, if any changes are made to existing CenturyLink accounts in any manner, all prior discounts will be void. Equipment: Customers may provide their own compatible equipment, lease from CenturyLink (up to $17/mo.), or one-time purchase (up to $200 + tax). Installation: A one-time installation fee may apply depending on network technology at customer location: Standard installation fee up to $25 (technician completes work outside of location and customer installs equipment /connects devices inside) or technician installation fee up to $149 (technician completes work outside of location and installs equipment /connects devices inside). Construction: For new Internet installations, construction charges apply (“Construction Charges”). Customers will pay $500 unless the total cost equals or exceeds $1,000, and in that case, Customer will be responsible to pay the entire amount of Construction Charges, which usually does not exceed $2,000. Customers must approve Construction Charges before work begins; either party may cancel with no further obligations. Billing: Month to month (referred to as “no contract”) service means no term commitment and may be cancelled at any time without an early termination fee but customer must accept Internet Subscriber Agreement prior to using service (see centurylink.com/eula). To receive advertised rate, customer must enroll in paperless billing and agree to not receive a paper invoice from CenturyLink. If paperless billing is cancelled or not activated in a timely manner, the then-current standard monthly rate will apply. Customer may access their monthly invoice in My CenturyLink online account. Customers who elect to receive a paper bill will be charged $2 for each applicable monthly bill. Postpay: A credit check or deposit may apply. Prepay: Service will begin on the date your order is completed and full payment is processed through your choice of bank account (via ACH payment), debit card, credit card, or other prepay service available with your subscription.  Each month following, a recurring e-commerce transaction for your service will be processed as service automatically renews monthly until cancelled by customer.  See centurylink.com/feesandtaxes for applicable taxes and fees. Additional restrictions apply.

Included in 2-year price guarantee at $89.99 advertised price: America's Top 120 programming package, local channels, HD service fees, and Hopper Duo for 1 TV.

Included in 2-year price guarantee for additional cost: Programming package upgrades ($104.99 for AT120+, $109.99 for AT200, $119.99 for AT250), monthly fees for upgraded or additional receivers ($5-$7 per additional TV, receivers with additional functionality may be $10-$15).

NOT included in 2-year price guarantee or advertised price (and subject to change): Taxes & surcharges, add-on programming (including premium channels), DISH Protect, and transactional fees.

Regional sports: RSN Surcharge up to $3/mo. applies to AT120+ and higher packages and varies based on location.

Premium channels 3 mos. free: After 3 mos., you will be billed $30/mo. for Paramount+ with SHOWTIME, Starz and DISH Movie Pack unless you call or go online to cancel.

Remote: The DISH Voice Remote requires internet-connected Hopper, Joey or Wally device. Customer must press the Voice Remote button to activate the feature.

Smart HD DVR included: Prices include Hopper Duo for qualifying customers. Hopper, Hopper w/Sling or Hopper 3 $5/mo. more. Upfront fees may apply based on credit qualification.

DISH Anywhere: Watching live and recorded TV anywhere requires an internet-connected Hopper w/Sling or Hopper 3 and compatible mobile device.

4K: Watching 4K requires a 4K TV

Autohop: Commercial skip feature is available at varying times, starting the day after airing, for select primetime shows on ABC, CBS, FOX, and NBC recorded with PrimeTime Anytime.

Reliability Guarantee: Limited time offer, subject to change. Available only to new or returning former customers. Guarantee covers signal loss outages due to normal weather and/or technical issues. Does not cover signal loss outages due to user error. Does not cover changes in programming content. To receive outage credits, you must contact DISH customer service by phone or chat within 72 hours of the outage. Upon verifying the outage, DISH will issue bill credits in daily increments from the time of the outage until the outage is restored. Not available to DISH Outdoors customers.

Other: All packages, programming, features, and functionality and all prices and fees not included in price guarantee are subject to change without notice. After 6 mos., if selected, you will be billed $12.99/mo. for DISH Protect unless you call to cancel. After 2 years, then-current everyday prices for all services apply. For business customers, additional monthly fees may apply. Free standard professional installation only.

Two Years of Netflix Included: Netflix Offers Requires new 24 mo. commitment with an early termination fee. Requires Hopper 3, Hopper Duo or Wally receiver. NF24 offer includes 24 months free Netflix standard without ads which is regularly priced as $17.99 per month. Netflix Standard with Ads plan included for 2 years ($7.99 monthly bill credit). After 2 years, you will pay the retail price unless you cancel. Netflix price not included in price lock offer and is subject to change. New and existing Netflix customers are eligible. Activation of Netflix service is required. Additional terms and conditions apply

Pick Your Pack Offer: New and qualifying former customers will receive selected package at no charge for the first 12 months. After 12 months, you will stop receiving the selected package unless you subscribe to the package. Prices, packages, programming and offers subject to change without notice. Multi-Sport Package requires subscription to America's Top 120 Plus or higher. This offer cannot be combined with any other offer. Other restrictions may apply. Netflix:*Change your Netflix plan when you activate your Netflix subscription or any time on http://mydish.com. If you link a Netflix account to your DISH package, canceling your DISH package or switching between package options will not automatically cancel your Netflix membership, and Netflix will continue charging your existing payment method.
The Netflix service is provided to you by Netflix under the Netflix Terms of Use, which will be provided to you separately. The other services included in your DISH package are provided by DISH. In order to enjoy the Netflix service included in your package from DISH, you will need to activate Netflix. You will receive instructions on how to activate Netflix via email and/or text message. Netflix Billing: You will be billed for Netflix by DISH immediately after it is added to your DISH package. If you already have an existing Netflix account, during activation you must link it to your DISH package to avoid separate charges. You will continue to be charged separately for any existing Netflix account until you link that account to your DISH package. Existing Netflix Membership: If you link an existing Netflix account to your DISH package, and then cancel your DISH package, Netflix will automatically resume charging your existing payment method that they have on file. Managing Netflix Account: If you wish to review or make changes to your Netflix membership please visit the ‘Account’ pages on the Netflix website or via MyDish. Loss of Bill Credits: If you drop below the minimum DISH programming requirements, you will lose the credits to your DISH bill. If you pause your service, any remaining credits will be forfeited and your remaining DISH commitment will resume when your service is unpaused. Netflix Promotional Offer End: When your DISH promotional offer including Netflix ends, you will continue to be billed by DISH for your Netflix subscription at the then-current retail price for your Netflix plan. Information Sharing: DISH will share the email address and/or phone number registered to your DISH account with Netflix to facilitate your activation of the Netflix service included in your DISH service. For further information about how DISH handles your personal data, please visit the Privacy Notice available on my.dish.com/privacy-notice. You can view Netflix’s Privacy Statement on netflix.com/privacy.

Why CenturyLink Home Phone works for you

CenturyLink Home Phone is designed to fit your lifestyle, offering the reliability and features you need to stay connected—without compromises. With no contracts and dependable performance, CenturyLink Home Phone ensures you stay connected on your terms.

Crystal-clear calling

Say goodbye to dropped calls and delays with reliable landline phone service that keeps conversations flowing.

Emergency accuracy

Landlines provide precise location data to emergency services, giving you peace of mind when it matters most.

Unlimited nationwide calling

Talk as much as you want with no overage charges—perfect for catching up with family and friends.

CenturyLink home phone for premium connectivity and peace of mind

With CenturyLink home phone, you get unlimited local and long-distance calls, advanced call management features like call forwarding and voicemail, and the peace of mind that comes with secure, private communication.

Unlimited local & long-distance calls

Stay in touch with friends, family, and colleagues without worrying about extra charges.

Advanced call features

Enjoy call forwarding, voicemail, caller ID, and more to make managing your calls easier.

Secure & private

Landline phones are less prone to security risks like data breaches or hacking, giving you peace of mind.

The Chattiest States in America: 2021 edition

The chattiest states in AmericaInteresting findingsMethodology

With fewer gatherings in person throughout the year, Americans talked on the phone 25% more often and calls lasted 15% longer in 2020, according to this report. For the second year in a row the CenturyLinkQuote team researched how much time Americans spent talking on the phone, texting, writing old-fashioned letters, and communicating by email to find out this year’s chattiest states.

Just as in our 2020 report, Nebraska was the chattiest state, its combined phone, email, and snail mail communication time going up from one hour and six minutes (1:06:00) to one hour and twenty-four minutes (1:24:00), well above the American average of 43 minutes per day.

On the other end of the spectrum, New Hampshire had the most reclusive residents, with only 19 minutes of total communication time per day, down from last year’s already low 31 minutes.

Check our map to see how much your state’s residents stay in touch by phone, email, and mail.

Get more with CenturyLink Internet and Home Phone bundles

Maximize your savings and flexibility with CenturyLink’s Internet and Home Phone bundles. Combine high-speed internet with a reliable landline phone for a cost-effective solution tailored to your needs.

Flexible bundling options. Choose from various plans to fit your household’s needs, whether you’re looking for high-speed Fiber Gigabit or a more affordable option.
High-speed internet. Enjoy super-fast speeds with Fiber Gigabit, ideal for streaming, gaming, and working from home.
Reliable landline phone service. Keep connected with CenturyLink Home Phone, offering crystal-clear calls and dependable emergency service.

Get more value by bundling your internet and home phone with CenturyLink.

Frequently asked questions

Does CenturyLink have stores?

No, CenturyLink doesn’t have in-person stores. If you’d like to pay your bill in person, you can visit one of our payment partners: CheckFreePay agents or Western Union agents. See what options are available in your area by visiting this CenturyLink FAQ page. If you’d like to order online, enter your ZIP Code in the search function at the top of this page to find internet plans from CenturyLink near you.

Where do I drop off my CenturyLink equipment?

You can drop off your CenturyLink equipment at any authorized UPS Shipping Center location. Learn more about how to ship your equipment by visiting this CenturyLink equipment return guide.

Frequently asked questions

Expand AllCollapse All

What is fiber internet?

Fiber internet service is a technology that transfers internet data by sending light signals through protected, ultrathin glass or plastic strands. Because of the efficiency of the technology, fiber is exceptionally fast and reliable.

Is fiber better or more reliable?

Where available, fiber offers fast, reliable, high-performing internet service with low latency (lag). As a result, you can stream with virtually no interruptions, game with confidence, and connect a multitude of devices to keep everyone in the house happy.

How fast is fiber?

Fiber internet services offer download and upload speeds in the triple digits—up to 940 Mbps with CenturyLink’s Fiber Gigabit service. At the maximum wired speed of 940 Mbps, download and upload times fly by:

7 minutes to download a 45 GB game
42 seconds to download a 4.6 GB movie
20 seconds to upload a 2.2 GB video

Speed may not be available in your area. Maximum download/upload speed of up to 940 Mbps via a wired connection.

How much does CenturyLink Fiber Internet cost?

Where available, CenturyLink fiber internet services offer speeds up to 940 Mbps at an affordable rate.

Can I get fiber internet in my area?

CenturyLink is expanding fiber service areas nationwide! Check availability at your ZIP code now or call 1-888-610-4095 to speak with an agent.

Is fiber internet better than WiFi?

Fiber internet and WiFi serve different purposes—fiber delivers the fastest, most reliable connection to your home, while WiFi spreads that connection wirelessly to your devices. A fiber connection gives you ultra-fast speeds and low latency, and when paired with a strong router, it ensures seamless WiFi performance throughout your home.

How much does fiber WiFi cost?

Fiber internet with WiFi cost depends on your chosen plan and provider. CenturyLink Fiber offers straightforward pricing with no annual contracts, and Fiber Gigabit plans come with FREE professional installation ($129 value) for new customers.

Is fiber the most reliable internet?

Yes! Fiber is the most reliable internet technology available today, offering 99.9% network reliability* with no slowdowns due to weather or network congestion. Unlike cable or DSL, fiber transmits data via light signals over glass strands, reducing interference and ensuring a fast, stable connection—even during peak hours.

*Based on network uptime or availability
